Name: Bushido: Kaihei Alpha
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Eight foot of lean muscle, a cunning, ruthless hunter. The Kaihei Alpha are the large and most ferocious of the Kaihei an already deadly beast. Like all packs it only functions with strong leadership and Alphas have this in spades, another creature born out of the unforgiving wilderness the Oni call home where only the strongest survive. In battle, under the Kaihei Alphas glare the pack moves as one, quickly and decidedly devouring their helpless prey alive, snapping and ripping in a bloody fury of tooth and claw. Of the many fighting beasts of the Oni the Kaihei rightly hold a place of feared in the minds of men.

Name: Bushido: Kaihei Pack
Description:
Description from the publisher:

These muscled hunters are pack animals and whilst fearsome in isolation they are truly terrifying when running in a group. Lean and agile they bound across the battlefield, throwing themselves with great momentum at their quarry, barrelling them to the ground whilst another in the pack snaps and tears at the exposed vital areas of the prey. Teeth and claws as hard as steel they can tear through even the toughest of Minimoto iron with a concentration bite.

Name: Bushido: Rashka The Devastator
Description:
Description from the publisher:

A monster of huge proportions even by Oni standards. On the battlefield he rampages through enemy lines, neither man nor metal can halt his carnage as he scatters soldiers like ants under his colossal shadow, swinging his desecrated tori arch in wide arcs. Those not broken by his initial impact are drilled mercilessly into the dirt as easily as a carpenter hammering nails, even the strongest armour offering little protection against his unworldly strength.

Name: Bushido: Rinsho
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Rinsho are prized within Bakemono society for their enormous strength matched only by their stupidity, making them perfect shock troops. These gangly Bakemono are blessed with vastly accelerated regenerative powers, able to regrow limbs and heal what would be mortal wounds as if minor graze. Their durability offers some staying power to the Bakemono battle lines, anchoring key points on the battle field, weathering the brunt of the enemy offense and enabling a swarming counter punch. Bringing down these giant Bakemono is no mean feat as injury only sends them spiralling into a furious whirlwind and violence.

Name: Bushido: Nightwing Swarm
Description:
Description from the publisher:

A thousand pair of red eyes glowing in the darkness, a thousand fangs thirsting for blood. The Wave and the Council of Shadow’s Shugenja have many tricks ready to play in the game of war. Now they have unleashed nightwings from their cage of rock and blackness. Like leather winged locusts they tear through the countryside, gorging on those unfortunate enough to be caught in their path, leaving only the withered husks, sucked dry as a reminder of their unquenchable thirst.

Name: Bushido: Bakemono Boomers
Description:
Description from the publisher:

A lot could be said for the subterranean races’ savage and cruel practices however their ability to adapt and change based on the environment and resources available cannot be ignored, their resourcefulness is something to be admired when considering the scarcity of materials offered in the dark places they claim as their own. Now with the world in turmoil, ravaged by war, the bakemono tribes pick the battlefields clean like maggots at a wound. This has led to the advancements of the Prefecture being turned against them. The boomers are one such example of this, two brave and possibly a little stupid bakemono eagerly working the famous ryu arquebus to deadly effect.

Name: Bushido: Bakemono Beast Rider
Description:
Description from the publisher:

As the war fought above and below ground intensifies all sides are pushed to find more weapons and soldiers to turn the tide in their favour. The Council of Shadows is no different and selects the bravest and foolhardiest of the bakemono warriors to capture and master the beasts that live in the shadows. Only the few survive, but those that do are able to ride these murderous monsters into battle with devastating effect.

Please be advised that this model requires Giant Cave Bat (BSW015) or The Nian (BSW008) to be played in game but can be used in conjunction with either.

Name: Bushido: Xi-Han & Zoo
Description:
Description from the publisher:

It is hard to tell if Xi-Han had lost his mind before or after he consumed every unusual mushroom he could find. The exact purpose of this pursuit remains a mystery. What is clear is that bizarrely he has managed to develop the ability to focus and force his body to replicate the effects of these rare and potent fungi. Sending his body into spasm and unleashing the deranged and violent “Zoo” for a short while to wreak havoc on his enemies. He also still maintains a constant supply of mushrooms on his person that he can throw in battle to Blind, Frighten or enrage anyone unlucky enough to inhale the spores.

Name: Bushido: Goro
Description:
Description from the publisher:

An Onisho forged in battle, beaten and bent over years of combat into a bundle of muscle and murderous energy. Years have taught Goro to anticipate the moves of his opponents, enabling him to time his offense with deadly precision. Knowing exactly when to use multiple crippling strikes or a single brutal blow to finish.

Name: Bushido: Savage Wave Special Card Pack 1
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create very a focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are three types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event and Terrain Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the factions strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Pack contains fourteen Special cards: Seven faction specific and seven generic cards.

Name: Bushido: Savage Wave Special Card Pack 2
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Pack contains fourteen faction specific special cards

Name: Dream Home: 156 Sunny Street – Game Room Promo Card
Description: Single promo card to 156 Sunny Street expansion. It is additional "friend" card which gives you 3 points for having Game Room adjacent to Bathroom or Kitchen in your home.

Name: Carcassonne: The Markets of Leipzig
Description:
Carcassonne: Die Märkte zu Leipzig (German for "The markets of Leipzig"), is a small expansion for Carcassonne. It contains four double-landscape tiles depicting marketplaces. It is only available in the "Carcassonne II" design.

The expansion was first released as a limited edition of total 600 examples: the 1st 300 examples at the "modell hobby spiel" in Leipzig from the 29th of September to the 1st of October 2017, and the 2nd 300 examples at the Spiel'17 in Essen from 26th to 29th of October 2017. This limited version was signed by Klaus-Jürgen Wrede and the CEO of Leipzig's trade fair center (Messe Leipzig) and contain 13 Followers/Meeples. A more general version is also available.

Rules of the expansion affect the many small farmhouses shown on tiles of all "Carcassonne II" expansions.

It also contains two double-landscape tiles for Carcassonne: Amazonas.

Part of the Carcassonne series.

Name: Catch-Up Game
Description: Catch-Up Game is a quiz game by Chris Budde, published by McClean Enterprises. The goal of the game is to answer questions from cards. Which question to read is determined by a die roll. The die have 6 sides: Easy, Hard, All, Choose, Easy and Hard. On a card there is two questions, one easy and one hard. If All is rolled, all players most answer one of the questions, the player selects (easy or hard). If Choose is rolled the player that rolled the die, must choose another player to answer one of the questions. The questions is about personal issues: What is your favorite color? or Name a personal goal.

Name: Company of Iron
Description:
Company of Iron is a squad-based skirmish game that reinvents WARMACHINE and HORDES battles as smaller confrontations between fewer warriors and their character leaders. Average games are played with 10–15 miniatures, and Company of Iron is compatible with the majority of the existing miniatures in the WARMACHINE and HORDES product lines. The rules for Company of Iron have been streamlined and do not include warcasters or warlocks but can include light warjacks and light warbeasts.

The Company of Iron box set is designed for two players and will contain two 20-point armies, including a unit of Cygnar Stormblades and a unit of Minion Farrow Brigands. Additionally, two all-new character solos will be included to lead their respective units: Lieutenant Gwen Keller and Agata, Queen of Carnage. These new models can be used in both Company of Iron and in WARMACHINE and HORDES. All components needed to play the game are in the box set, including rules, tokens, and two types of cards that allow players to choose specialties for their squad leaders as well as battle plans that can provide powerful effects and advantages in combat.

Company of Iron uses the core rules of WARMACHINE and HORDES but has been tailored for the scale of the game and the absence of warcasters and warlocks. Emphasizing its fast-paced skirmish scale and the focus on small squads and solos, gameplay revolves around players taking turns activating one model at a time as opposed to the alternating activation in WARMACHINE and HORDES, in which players activate their entire army during a single turn.

“We have designed Company of Iron as an ideal entry point for new players who want to play in the world of WARMACHINE and HORDES,” said Chief Creative Officer Matt Wilson. “But it’s also a product the existing WARMACHINE and HORDES community has been requesting for years, and it scratches that itch for players craving a fast-paced tactical experience that can be played with a shorter time commitment.”

—description from the publisher

Name: Jump In
Description:
Jump In is a fast-paced card game created by Lycee Classique Echternach students (Luxemburg) and developed by D. Kirps and C. Kruchten. The clever combination of dice and cards throws demands constant attention, good reflexes and provides high playing pleasure.
—description from the publisher (English)

Jump In ist ein reaktionsschnelles Kartenspiel, erfunden von Studenten des Lycee Classique Echternach (Luxemburg) und entwickelt durch D. Kirps und C. Kruchten. Die pfiffige Kombination aus wuerfeln und Karten abwerfen verbindet ständige Aufmerksamkeit, gute Reflexe und hohen Spielspass.
—description from the publisher (German)

Jump In est un jeu de cartes rapide invente par des etudiants du Lycee Classique echternach (Luxembourg) et developpe par D. Kirps et C. Kruchten. La combinaison intelligente de lancer le de et defausser ses cartes attire l'attention et necessite de bons reflexes chez les joueurs qui y prennent plaisir rapidement.
—description from the publisher (French)

Name: Fake News or Not?
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Fake News or Not? is a game about phony funny stories and ludicrous true tales!  Life writes the craziest stories, but what can we believe and what is just a pack of lies?

One player (the News Anchor for that round) reads a News Card to the other players.  Each News Card contains the first part of a news story and 4 possible conclusions to the story.  One conclusion is correct and the true (Real News) answer, but the others are made-up (Fake News) falsehoods.  The News Anchor reads the Real News answer and picks one Fake News answer to read.  The other players then vote on which they believe to be the Real News.  Each player who votes for the Real News answer receives 1 point.  A different player takes on the role of the News Anchor each round.  The game ends after each player has had two turns as the News Anchor and the player with the most points wins!

Name: Tribal
Description:
Honour is everything! Tribal provides players with a game set in a pre-gunpowder tribal/clan setting. The rules  offer some new and exciting approaches to wargaming.

In the book you get: the basic rules; optional rules for missile fire, dirty tricks and honour pools; four scenarios you can play in a variety of tribal settings; in-depth explanation of culture, weapons and combat for Maori, Vikings, Aztecs & Gladiators; extra rules for Stone-Age, Heian Japanese & Iroquois.

Honour is used to drive the narrative of the game. Players are rewarded in honour for the things that they do in the battle. Honour determines who wins Tribal rather than the normal determinants of wargames (killing enemy/taking ground). In turn, honour is a dynamic part of the game - it can be won and lost during combat, the deeds of combatants can win or lose honour, players can spend honour to do 'dirty tricks' to win combats etc.

The game is played with a normal deck of cards. Cards determine movement, unit activation and - most importantly - combat. While cards still have the randomness of the draw from the deck, players can actually be involved in the combat through playing/holding particular cards. Attacking, defending, waiting for an opening, bluffing the opponent - these are all strategies the player can use in a round of Tribal combat.

—description from the publisher

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Fantastic Booster
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Killer Bunnies are back, do a double take, with fan-inspired cards that will make you quake! The Fantastic Booster Deck adds 55 cards to your existing set plus 27 unique small cards!

New cards include: a Dated Dolla to make you holler, a Soft Kitty Warm Kitty to cure an ill and make you sound witty.  Staring contests are plenty of fun when you play the card Blinky Madison.  Use your phone to play Text Time or Trip's Trips for a new paradigm.  There's a nice nod to Apple's Steve and a Drazi Feud if you can believe!

Bunny Triplets are for the birds, dispersed in part by Angry Nerds, and if you can count to 99 then you'll find Carrot N quite fine.  Full steam ahead, we're back on track, Fantastic is a new booster you should not lack!

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Caramel Swirl Booster
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Drenched in sweetness, new and delicious, the next Killer Bunnies Booster Deck is witty and auspicious! Caramel Swirl adds 55 cards to your existing set plus a brown 12-sided die.

Other alluring cards include the feminine forces of the Verminator or Omega Mu, and Johnny Wishbone to test psychic abilities for you.  Funky Fungus affects a weapon card and the Sacred Chalice gives you a financial vanguard.  Cherry Cordial will keep the game clean but Alternate Uhura will prove quite mean.

The most powerful bunnies will take note when you play the card Island Vote.  You might say "Fuff" and you might say "Ew" when you're asked to play Smell That Shoe!

Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to an all-new flavor.  Take the new deck for a whirl, the delicate and delectable Caramel Swirl!

Name: Laruna: Age of Kingdoms
Description:
Age of Kingdoms (AOK) is an epic-fantasy 4x board game where players lead the nations of Laruna in their quest to earn the favor of the gods. As powerful magic wielding rulers, players will fight, trade, and spell-sling their way into the god’s good graces in their race to earn the most glory before the end of time. 
With thought provoking design, this worker placement-miniature battle hybrid will have players utilizing strategy to defeat one another through careful use of spells, territory control, unit advancement and economic development.
 Choosing between 10 ruler archetypes, 6 kingdoms and over 40 recruitable units, players will earn glory by way of war, trade, or mutual achievements, allowing them versatility in both their tactics and playstyle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Frostgrave: The Maze of Malcor
Description:
Part magical university, part museum, part tourist attraction, the great Collegium of Artistry had flourished in Felstad's final days. Under the leadership of the seemingly immortal Malcor the Mad, the vast complex expanded, with new wings being built wherever they would fit, including up and down the rock face, and even buried within the mountain itself. Visitors called it one of the architectural wonders of the world; the students, who often got lost in its endless tunnels, simply called it "The Maze."

With a titanic crash, an immense ice shelf tears free from the mountains that that loom above Frostgrave, revealing the lost Collegium, and the race for its secrets begins. The Maze is known to have contained many rare and unique treasures, and who knows what may have survived . . .

This new, bumper-sized supplement for Frostgrave contains a host of new adventures, treasures, and creatures to challenge players. It also includes its own, unique campaign and experience system, as well as information about several of the mythical lost schools of magic.

—description from the publisher

Name: Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago – Lost Colossus
Description:
Long ago, the great Colossus of Argantheon stood upon one of the outer islands, its vast, outstretched arm pointing the way to the Crystal Pool, or so the ancient texts claim. Then, during some forgotten war, the Colossus was shattered, and its parts flung across the Archipelago, to lie in forgotten ruin.

In this expansion for Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago, players lead their warbands through a series of interlinked scenarios in a race to discover the secrets of the Colossus. Along the way, they will encounter new monsters, discover new treasures, and even recruit a few new specialist warriors to their cause. Perhaps, if they are successful, the knowledge they obtain will help point them towards the ultimate treasure!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Uthuk Y'llan Army Expansion
Description:
A new evil force enters the battle for Terrinoth with the Uthuk Y'llan Army Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game. The army of the Locust Horde includes four new demonic units with the Uthuk Berserks, Flesh Rippers, Spine Threshers, and their dark hero Ravos the Everhungry. In addition to twenty-two customizable figurines, the expansion includes tokens, terrain pieces and cards, and twelve upgrade cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Riga: 5+6 Player Expansion
Description: Riga: 5+6 Player Expansion does just what you might expect — allow for games of Riga to include up to six players. To do this, this expansion includes 55 cards, including 22 ware cards, 24 building cards, and 8 Riga-specific building cards.

Name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Terry McGinnis Promo Cards
Description:
Promo cards created for the Rainbow Draft Weekend 2, including full art card, sketch variant (blank) card and die.

Terry McGinnis: Batman Beyond card text:
When you purchase a non-Basic Action Die with printed cost less than the number of your active characters, add it to your Prep Area.
Max: 4

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Melinda May Promo Cards
Description:
Promo cards created for the Rainbow Draft Weekend 2, including full art card, sketch variant (blank) card and die.

Melinda May: Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D. card text:
While you have another active character die, Melinda May has Iron Will. 
Teamwatch - Deal 1 damage to target character die or opponent. 
MAX: 4

Name: OOF-DAH!
Description:
OOF-DAH! is an American Specialty tabletop boardgame for 2-4 players.  It has educational content, but the real focus is on fun, competition, and endlessly creative and varied gameplay.  The theme is based on organic farming, and the goal is to collect Hunger Tokens by growing organic vegetables on your farm, and feeding local communities. If you play strategically and negotiate successfully with fellow players, or Growers, you can increase your odds of doing well at the Farmer's Market, which dictates crop values and market pricing.  
     Game-play consists of turn-based die rolls, accompanied by trading between turns.  Multiple events may occur on die rolls, allowing for a nonlinear and more engaging style of play.  Players, or Growers, must adapt on the fly to ever-changing in-game conditions.  A Grower may only score an OOF-DAH! if they grow the right crops on the right cover crops, and if they harvest the correct crops according to the ideal growing season.
     Additional scoring opportunities are facilitated by novel features such as Crop Combos, Crop Cartels, Undercutting, and targeted Guard Token protections.  Only the savviest Growers with the keenest sense of what's hot and what's not in the Market, will meet all challenges, earning the right to say, "OOF-DAH!"

Name: Justice League: Road Trip
Description:
The earths most loathsome villains are at it again. Causing destruction and widespread panic on a level never before seen. As you attempt to make contact with the rest of the team, the WATCHTOWER is attacked.

Seconds before communications went dark, a partial message was intercepted from the plant APOKALIPS. The sourct of the message can mean only one thing - DARKSEID.
The details are vague, but the message was clear; DARKSEID calls for the destruction of the JLA. Cut off from the rest of the team, you rush out in search of the JLA's most nefarious villains in order to stop DARKSEID's evil plot.

Travel through the game board collecting information on DARKSEID's master plan. Carry out board actions, collect HIT TOKENS, and acquire TOLL PASSES while you dish out hard justice in HENCHMEN BATTLES. Gain access to the criminal underworld that lead to ENEMY STRONGHOLDS in your search of Earth's most loathsome villains. Return the villains to your BASE CAMP for information to help you foil DARKSEID's sinister plot. The first person to complete their SCORE CARD by Acquiring 4 unique VILLAIN TOKENS and return them to their BASE CAMP is the winner.
—description from the publisher

Name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Mr. Whiffle Promo Card
Description:
Apocrypha Adventure Card Game by Lone Shark Games can be played as a cooperative card game or a role-playing game set in a pre-apocalyptic world.  Their own Patrick Rothfuss contributed to the storytelling. Impress your friends with this horribly awesome Mr Whiffle card!

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

Body Gift
Discard: Boost Body.
Support - Slot: While Slotted,
-active saint Donate to Charity: Draw 1 new Omen.  If it is an Omen of Doom, sacrifice Mr. Whiffle.

Keywords: Dreamer, Ally, Tool, Charm

Name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Oversized Villain Cards
Description:
These 4" by 6" cards represent all of the villains from the Sentinels of the Multiverse core game as well as the Rook City, Infernal Relics, Shattered Timelines, and Wrath of the Cosmos expansions. This set of 31 oversized villain cards even comes with villain character cards for each of the villain mini-expansions and promos, including two new promos never seen before!

Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards was previously released as an accessory.

Name: Galacta: Star Commandos
Description:
Publisher Description

Star Commandos is an adventure game--played with miniature figures--which simulates futuristic combat during the great Rebellion against the interstellar Galactan Empire. Here is a realistic game in which you choose the troops and weapon-types you wish to use, and then control the action in a daring commando raid in the far future.

User Summary

A Galacta series game from Heritage USA's Paint 'N' Play line.

The Paint 'N' Play games all featured Heritage miniatures along with paints and painting instructions. Unlike the other Paint 'N' Play games, which featured a board, the Galacta series games were straight miniatures rules designed to be played directly on the tabletop.

The contents included metal miniature figures, paints, a brush, "adventure game rules", and a 12-sided die. Heritage sold additional Galacta 25mm figures that could be used with the games.

Name: Galacta: Galactic Rebellion
Description:
Publisher Description

Galactic Rebellion is an adventure game--played with miniature figures--which simulates futuristic combat during the great Rebellion against the interstellar Galactan Empire. Here is a realistic game in which you choose the troops and weapons you wish to use, and then command the attack (or defense).

Included in Galactic Rebellion are stormtroopers, rebel adventurers, alien octopoid troopers, planetary striker troops, and two types of robots.

User Summary

A Galacta series game from Heritage USA's Paint 'N' Play line.

The Paint 'N' Play games all featured Heritage miniatures along with paints and painting instructions. Unlike the other Paint 'N' Play games, which featured a board, the Galacta series games were straight miniatures rules designed to be played directly on the tabletop.

The contents included metal miniature figures, paints, a brush, "adventure game rules", and a 12-sided die. Heritage sold additional Galacta 25mm figures that could be used with the games.

Name: HeroClix ID Card
Description:
From publisher's comprehensive rulebook: 
Heroclix ID cards show that a character on your force has a special contact within a larger organization that may be able to
temporarily help. Many, but not all ID cards say they are “Unique”, and therefore only one ID card with that set symbol and collector number can be added to your force. When adding an ID card to your starting force, you must also add an associated ID character to your Sideline. [ID cards have a cost of 5.]

Here is the text of ID cards:
Inspiration: “A specific effect that varies from ID card to ID card.”
Setup – At the beginning of the game, choose a character on your sideline with a name or real name matching this ID Card and turn it to a starting line. This character is called an ID Character. You can’t have more ID characters on your force than you have characters placed on the map at the beginning of the game. (If the card is Unique, it will say so here.)
Call in Help – At the beginning of your turn, you may activate one ID Card per force. To activate an ID Card, choose a friendly character that has no action tokens and is equal to or more points than the ID Character's starting line. Give the chosen character a power action, place the ID Character adjacent to it, and then remove this ID Card from the game and your opponent scores it. The ID characters can’t be carried, given double power actions, replaced, or assigned resources. The ID character returns to your sideline immediately: (a) at the beginning of your next turn, (b) if it's not within 5 squares of the chosen character, or (c) if it is removed from the map by another game effect.
Inspire – When a character friendly to an ID Character is in an adjacent square, they can use that ID Character's Inspiration.

Name: Stop Thief!: Jason L'Mean Promo Card
Description:
Promo card given out from the 2017 Dice Tower Indiegogo campaign.

Jason L'Mean - When captured, All other investigators choose and discard a movement card (other than their lowest one) Value: $8,000

Name: Widower's Wood: Dead Men Walking
Description:
THE CLUTCHES OF DEATH BECKON…

An ancient cult of necromancers stirs throughout the darker reaches of western Immoren and bids the dead to rise up against the living. From the crumbling subterranean passages of the Undercity to the swamps of the Widower’s Wood, these masters of death work toward unseen ends more nefarious than any might imagine. Only those brave few willing to face their own mortality can have any hope of stopping the sinister plots unfolding in the shadows. Steel yourself and prepare to send wraiths, boneswarms, and other unspeakable horrors back to the grave!

The Dead Men Walking expansion contains six new scenarios that pit players against hosts of undead servants and their ï¬endish masters. These compelling scenarios can be played on their own or mixed into the larger campaigns of The Undercity and Widower’s Wood.

—description from the publisher

Name: Die klugen Staatsbürger
Description:
User summary:

The players choose a profession (office worker, laborer, physician, farmer, craftsman, trader) and may take the roles of mayor, cashier, city manager, journalist.
The pawns are moved around the board clockwise. Movement is determined by a die. Some spaces or event cards make the players earn or lose money. Money is needed to gain achievement token by  building muncipal buildings to improve the infrastructure of the city.

When all muncipal buildings are finished, the player with the most achievement token wins the game.

Included on the backside of the game board is the travel game "Österreich-Rundfahrt", where the players have to answer quiz questions about the municipal companies in every city the reach.

Name: Nimbee: The Bee's Knees
Description:
Nimbee: The Bee's Knees is a small expansion for the Nimbee  base game that consists of five new bonus cards to swap in to offer a new balance to in-game decisions.

The Bee's Knees deck was developed by BGG users in an August 2017 competition to create new bonus cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Leap Frog
Description: Leap Frog is a game created in New Zealand where opponents pieces are captured by leaping over them. To start each player in turn places one of their four counters in any slot of the nine slots around the circle on the board. Each player in turn then performs a slide move, double jump or jump move, though if the next player can not move, the player who just moved takes another turn. The first player to capture all four of his opponents pieces wins the game.

Name: Taluva: Extension
Description: Taluva Extension is for the basic Taluva game from Ferti, not Taluva Deluxe. It contains the two-hex tiles expansion, the ships expansion, the fifth player expansion, and the game board expansion.

Name: Piraten kapern: Sonderkarten
Description:
A mini-expansion for Piraten Kapern, released in a promo pack at the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austria.

This blister contains two sorts of special cards which can be added to the game. Each special card is available 4 times.

The function of the first special card, called "Nach dem Sturm" ("After the storm!), is: You are allowed to roll any amount of dice just 2 times. You are still not allowed to reroll any skulls, but even with more than 3 skulls on first roll, you are allowed to reroll. You are not allowed to go to Skull Island and only receive points for each diamond and each gold coin, but twice the amount.

The second card is "Frieden" ("Peace"): You have to end your turn without any sabre. If you succeed, you get double the points, else you get -1000 points for each sabre, you had rolled and no points for your other rolls. You are allowed to go to Skull Island, but even there you are not allowed to roll sabres.

Name: Image Factory
Description:
A robot-themed, cooperative "drawing quiz game".

All players but one draw two "theme cards" and draw a character representing the combination of the words written (i.e. "Dog" and "President") in 30 seconds.

After drawing a character, all "theme cards" are gathered and shuffled. A number of extra cards may be added, depending on player count.

The one player who did not draw that round must select the correct combination that applies to each drawing from among the mixed cards.

Name: Maestro Nefario
Description: Card game with music theme and combines a 3x3 grid, invoking that of tic-tac-toe. 2 players compete to create the patterns required for performing music pieces.

Name: Deities Domination
Description:
The story for Deities Domination picks up at the end of a great war. The war to regain the 7 realms from the darkness felled many, including the First of the Gods. As the realms recover, the Gods that once fought together now vie against each other to claim the empty throne.

As a player in the game, choose to be one of several Gods from different clans, each with unique powers and abilities. Players direct their tribe to build, battle monsters, and explore new territories. As a God, players can choose to be Benevolent, focusing on building their tribe or giving gifts to other tribes, or Malevolent, striking down the resources and Heroes of their own or that of other tribes.

The game combines elements of 4x with a deck building mechanic. Each game play is designed to be unique, with multiple characters, a modular map, and several actions for each player to choose from each turn. The race to claim the throne is won by the first player to achieve 12 Victory Points. You can choose to expand your tribes through villages and shrines, build a magnificent temple and collect tributes, go the battle route and fight monsters, take a balanced approach or more.

Deities Domination is a versatile game, designed to maximize replayability. While players may have temporary setbacks, no one is eliminated from the game, and the structure of the game allows for recovery from asymmetric distribution of power, giving players the ability to recoup from disadvantageous situations. The combination of new map layouts, Gods’ abilities, and multiple paths to victory creates an inimitable experience each game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Conquer: The Ultimate Drinking Game
Description:
Conquer: The Ultimate Drinking Game, is an adult party game that combines strategy board game with drinking. In the game players can take drinks to purchase bonuses for their armies, like extra troops or a shield. Conquer is a game of balance. As player's drink and collect bonuses they also start to lose their mental focus.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dragon Ball Super-Cosmic contest
Description:
Players play cards in turn.
Score or steal score.
A player with a score of one hundred points wins.
Five minutes simple game.

Name: Geistesblitz: Gratis Demo-Spiel
Description:
A Demoversion of Ghost Blitz, released in a promotional package for the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austria. Rules of the original game applies, but the deck is slimmed down.

Components:
20 cards (main deck)
5 cards to replace the wooden objects
1 card with rules (German)
1 cover card

Name: Gothic: A Dark Companion for In Her Majesty's Name
Description:
This is the third supplement for the game and has been produced by The Ministry of Gentlemanly Warfare, authors of IHMN, DaishÅ and Blood Eagle.

Within these pages, you shall find new weapons and equipment, talents and powers, and creatures both normal and supernatural. As well as a host of new companies to fight or, bring on, the darkness that threatens to engulf the Old World.

You will meet old enemies such as Vlad Tepes, Prince of Wallachia, and his nemesis Abraham van Helsing. Play the brave men of the Imperial Nightwatch as they test their modern might against the terrifying vampire minions of the immortal Countess Bathory. Rouse the Village mob to drive out Baron Viktor von Frankenstein and his abominations. Tread the corridors of power as a member of the Illuminati or, join the Gypsies to hunt Werewolves under the full moon. Witness Sampson Caine and the Nuns of the Order of the Bringer of Salvation defend the innocent from the predations of the Dread Monks of Sucevita. Unleash the Unborn upon the terrible White Slavers. You can also upgrade and test your existing IHMN companies against these many terrors.

New scenarios and landscapes will take your companies into dark forests, mist shrouded castles, ancient ruins, pagan altars and grim, fortified villages the length and breadth of Transylvania, Wallachia and the ever-forbidding Carpathian Mountains.

This is classic Victorian Gothic Horror at its grisly, horripilating best. It is not recommended for ladies and gentlemen of a nervous disposition, for the darkness will feed upon their terror.

—description from the publisher

Note: Gothic is not a stand alone game, and you will need a copy of In Her Majesty’s Name from Osprey publishing in order to play.

Name: Bushido: Cult of Yurei Special Card Pack 1
Description: Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create very a focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are three types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event and Terrain Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the factions strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Name: Bushido: Cult of Yurei Special Card Pack 2
Description: Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focused, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Name: Bushido: Temple of Ro-Kan Special Card Pack 1
Description: Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create very a focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are three types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event and Terrain Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the factions strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Name: Bushido: Temple of Ro-Kan Special Card Pack 2
Description: Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Name: Bushido: Prefecture of Ryu Special Card Pack 1
Description: Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create very a focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are three types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event and Terrain Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the factions strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Iron Gang
Description:
Engines roar through the night sky as you see clouds of dust coming your way. Hot tires screech across the road as hundreds of riders wreck havoc to anything on their path. They are followed by heavily armored warriors, intimidating everyone with a cacophony of metallic sounds made by their chains, net launchers, and other weapons of post apocalyptic war.

First, the riders are going to surround and entangle you with their web of steel. Melee fighters will follow soon after, bringing pain and destruction. Even if you are going to defend yourself, even if you manage defeat one of them, more replace their fallen comrade.

Death is coming your way. You can try to run. You can try to hide. But sooner or later, you are going to fall into their hands. This is not your average gang – this is Iron Gang, a brutal group that has perfected the art of the hunt from the back of the steel steed.

Neuroshima Hex: Iron Gang introduces a new army pack to Neuroshima Hex!, and both the HQ and certain units feature a new "chain" ability. Chain connects two units with that ability if there is a straight line between them, and it allows them to target and hit any unit on that line.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Prefecture of Ryu Special Card Pack 2
Description: Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Name: Top Trumps Star Wars: Tseebo Promo Card
Description:
A single promo card for the Top Trumps: Star Wars Rebels deck, released in a promotional package for the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austrian.

Stats:
Force: 8
Speed: 7
Fire power:15
Influence: 12
Reliability: 28

Top Trumps Info (translated from German card):
Tseebo (TM) was a close friend of Ezra Bridger's (TM) parents and was working for the "Imperial Office of Information", from where he escaped, carrying confidential files. He was wanted by "the Empire", but saved by Ezra and "the Rebels".

Name: Nordwind (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description: This will be my first Fan-Expansion for T.I.M.E Stories based on the Viking Age.

Name: Myth of Theuth
Description:
When he came to the alphabet, Theuth said: "This art, O king, will make the Egyptians wiser and richer in memory." This is the myth of the invention of writing according to Plato’s Phaidros, which MYTH OF THEUTH takes as base for a playful examination of media theories.

In this fantastic game you will move through ancient Athens, collecting different media in order to complete a mission. You will meet famous people who greatly influenced the development of media and cultural theories. Gotthold Ephraim Lessing shows you the limits of the image, Laura Mulvey takes a delightful gaze on your memorizing abilities, and Marshall McLuhan finally gets his well-deserved massage. Across the 12 stations, you will use smartphones, newspapers, stamps, candy, hand, feet, pairs of eyes, and other means to discover the Myth of Theuth. Whoever manages to finish the mission first – with a combination of strategy, luck, and knowledge – will be worshiped as a divine medium!

MYTH OF THEUTH is designed as a board game, which will be available in three different versions in English and German:


     PHAEDRUS, free available version to produce at home, needs approx. 5 to 6 hours;
     PLATON, standard version, first edition of 500 pcs.
     THEUTH, exclusive version, higher quality of used materials, additional game material (own game pieces, paper, pencils, newspaper articles, post-it notes, candies, LEGO bricks, blindfold, liqueur, envelopes, stamps), limited edition of 100 pcs., signed by artists.

Name: Mixed Constructions
Description:
Mixed Construction: A sentence that has incompatible elements; the sentence begins one way, with one kind of structure, and then shifts to a different structure.

In this cooperative wordplay game, a team of players works together to create a clue about a person, place or thing given to them from a randomly drawn card. Their partner will be trying to guess what's on their card. Mixed Constructions is a race against the clock where the team works together to maximize the number of correct guesses.

The catch is: players giving the clue can only say one word at a time!
—description from the designer

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Michonne Booster
Description: This is a playable Michonne miniature. It was originally a Kickstarter-exclusive figure but was later made available  to purchase through Mantic's website with Mantic points.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Project Z: Motorbike Gang
Description: Expansion for Project Z. Includes 8 plastic miniatures (have to be assembled) and 25 game cards.

Name: Eschaton: Sigils of Ruin
Description:
Sigils of Ruin is an expansion for Eschaton.

Before the great battle at the end of days, each player chooses one of six special characters to act as champion for their cult deck. This champion will play alongside other cultists, but will influence the overall play style of the deck in a direction defined by the champion’s affiliation.

Partnered with each champion is a corresponding avatar. Through the ritual invocations based on their champion’s affiliation, a cult will eventually be able to summon their avatar to join their deck. These avatars are not only powerful characters, but the direct path to the Sigils of Ruin.

Once the avatar has served their purpose on the mortal plane, they can be sacrificed to channel the cult’s corresponding sigil. When conjured, these sigils are immovable auras that bestow their cult with unique abilities and victory conditions. Although no two paths are the same, they each demand equal favor from the Dark One.

—description from the publisher

Name: Heroes of Normandie: Gazette #7
Description:
Contents:

• 2 punchboards with the Commandos Kieffer, the Casino of Ouistreham and the artillerie batterie german units.

• Two 6-page booklets (English AND French) containing:

- Historical information about Philippe Kieffer and the 1er Bataillon de Fusiliers Marins Commandos (1er BFMC, Free French Forces)
- Scenario "The breach" – Commonwealth (335 pts) against Germans (165 pts) (need the D-Day scenario pack, the Commonwealth Army box and the Devil Pig News #1)
- Scenario "Place your bets" – Commonwealth (345) against Germans (205) (need the Carentan scenario pack and the Commonwealth Army box)
- Scenario "Counter attack" – Commonwealth (915) against Germans (795) (need the Lord Lovat Blister pack, Pegasus Bridge scenario pack, the GE 21st Panzerdivision and the Commonwealth Army box)

• 1 sticker sheet for the storage system:

2 stickers for the Commandos Kieffer storage box
1 sticker for german Orders option and german officiers
1 sticker for US Orders option and US officiers
1 sticker for Commonwealth Orders option and Commonwealth officiers
3 blank stickers

Scenarios require D-Day, Carentan, Pegasus Bridge, Lord Lovat's Commandos, German Army Box, and Reinforcement-GE 21eme PZ expansions
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Heroes of Normandie: Gazette #6
Description:
Contents:

• 1 punchboard with new NCOs (with possibilities of specialisations), “Shaked” markers and “Routed” markers for moral rules.

• Two 6-page booklets (one in English, one in French) containing:

- 2 short stories about moral
- Scenario « More bridges? » – US (1020 pts) against Germans (1050 pts) (need the Battleground set, the River set, the US Army box, the German Army box and the Devil Pig News #1)
- Scenario « So, what’s next, chief? » – US (depending of the previous scenario) against Germans (depending of the previous scenario) (stuff required, see previous scenario)
- New rules about moral, linked to officers and NCOs presents on the Battlefield.

Scenarios require River Set and Battleground terrain expansions as well as the US and German Army Boxes.
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Festival of Thousand Cats: Sakazuki Promo
Description: Before setting up the game, add these two special cards into the deck to replace the two cards of the same season number from the basic game. The special cards will change the game end condition.

Name: マゴス (Magos)
Description:
User summary
ãƒžã‚´ã‚¹ (Magos) is a dice game for one or two people. Battle each other with magic and defeat your opponent.

Each player is a wizard. Choose 5 spells and beat down the opponent's wizard. When it comes to your turn, use 1 to 4 dice and assign and use spells.

The game includes four 6-sided dice, cubes for Hit Points and Mana, and 33 illustrated spell cards. The game is also offered in a Print & Play (PnP) version and online.

Name: Irrgang
Description: Each playes has to get his pawn from "Start" to "Ziel". Movement is determined by one die. The players have to get on every space marked with a letter. From there, the rolled number decides the direction of movement.

Name: ekklesia
Description:
Ekklesia is a variant of Careers. The players set their own victory conditions. A player may choose to pursue faith, love, joy or a combination of all three. The total number of "points" earned in the 3 categories must total 50. Money is only a means to achieve these goals.

The players move their pawns arrond the board. Movement is determined by a die. Some spaces events influence the players movement, gains them money or cause them to spend money. Other spaces cause the players to draw a card and follow the instructions printed there. The players try to fulfill their goal by going through any number of different detours. On finishing a detour, the player gets a movement card, that he may use instead of rolling the die at a time of his own choosing.

The player who gets to his pre-set goal first wins the game.

Name: Kennziffer 01 zero one
Description: The players start at London airport (center space). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to return to London after concluding the four journeys wins the game.

Name: Tracers
Description:
Tracers is a 1-4 player deck-building board game in which players take on the role of androids after a failed rebellion.    Having their numbers decimated in the android wars, in which they sought their emancipation, they now seek to inject their consciousness into cyberspace and steal the secret to sentient life from the humans in order to replenish their numbers.

The board is comprised of spaces connected by pathways, representing various systems which can be hacked.  Players start with a 12 card deck and a 6 card hand and cooperate to survive while competing for victory points.  They roll dice against their hack points to hack systems and, if successful, get to add better cards to their deck.  If unsuccessful they generate "trace" which may draw enemy A.I. called "hunters" to their location.  If more than one player hacks the same system (i.e. space on the board) the threat of a "tracers" attack grows, tracers being strange and powerful creatures that roam cyberspace.

The goal is to hack two well protected systems and acquire the tokens there which represent the human data, but they will have to have strong hacking abilities and protective gear to overcome that challenge.

Name: Andrana Project
Description:
THE STORY

Year 2067: global warming is no longer a prophecy but a reality.
The world, as we know it, has changed. Cities, governments, and nationalities got diluted giving way to a single world power, the World Federation. This new order represents few privileged, citizens of former first powers who today live protected from the chaos and misery that invades the planet. The rest of humanity migrates aimlessly on the run from war, hunger, and destruction left behind by climate change.

Meanwhile, the new world, driven by state-of-the-art technology, raises its walls seeking isolation from chaos. Set in the form of Smart Cities and defended by machines, the new world order is forced to find a solution to uncover illegal immigrants who manage to cross its borders and disguise among its citizens. Andrana Project, a Nano chip implanted in the nape of its inhabitants is the new identity document. From this moment on, everything involving a person is linked to their nanochip: their identity, bank and medical details, properties, titles... everything.

Project Andrana is well received by the majority of the population, although many are opposed to its potential risks. In this context, an old ideological movement begins to acquire strength and prominence: The Neoluddites.

Convinced that technology has a negative impact on people, their communities and the environment, Neoluddites believe that social and ecological collapse condemns most of the world's population to live in misery. Although this ideology has been alive for years, its followers had just passively abandoned technology until the arrival of Project Andrana, after which they started to get organized to act as a group. Neoluddites are dispersed all over the world and they know no frontiers. There are different factions, some more pacifist, and other more radical ones, determined to end the hegemony of the World Federation, which has taken technological evolution to the extreme. In time, some citizens of the World Federation will join this movement, tearing their nanochip off, becoming exiles and preparing to fight the system.
 Constant confrontations between the World Federation and the Neoluddites will shape the fate of humanity.

THE GAME

This is the plot of Andrana Project, an independent game that will be able to test your strategic ability, emotional intelligence, teamwork capacity and leadership skills.

Andrana Project is a phygital social game, this means that it is a group game, played face to face, supported on your smart phone or tablet.

To play Andrana Project you need a minimum of 4 players with smartphone/tablet and Internet connection. Every player needs to download the game, one of them will start the game and each of them will be assigned a team and a character.

In Andrana Project there are two opposing teams: the Neoluddites and the World Federation. Players from both teams have to discover their opponents to shut them down. The game has different missions that will get upgraded depending on how much it’s played.

Each player will be assigned a different character from each team, which means also different abilities and power inside the game.

These are the main powers of each of them (among many others):

The Neoluddites leader: As the Leader, he can recruit citizens. If he recruits a citizen he/she will become a Neoluddite and will fight for his team.

Neoluddites Doctor: As a Doctor, she can heal herself or any player she wants, so she can prevent that person of dying.

Neoluddites Citizen: As a citizen, they can save someone’ life, giving theirs instead. If they save someone from their team will result in a lot of points.

All Neoluddites have to be careful when stealing the access. If they steal the wrong person their identity will be revealed to that player.

Cybersecurity: As Cybersecurity, they can spy on one player to know his/her identity. They have the module, the Andrana server’s access. The Neoluddites want to steal them. The Agent knows who this person is and he will try to protect him.

DCS Agent: A DCS Agent can arrest other players to disable them in the next round. They are the only one who can recharge their weapon and attack more than once.
They must protect Cybersecurity, being aware of shooting him, if they kill him their team loses the game.

CITIZEN: As a citizen, they can save someone’s life, giving theirs instead. If they save someone from their team will result in a lot of points.

Each player needs to hide its identity from the rest, and at the same time observe their opponents to uncover theirs.

Name: Cypress Legacy
Description:
Cypress Legacy: The Board Game is for 2 to 6 players taking place in one of the Cypress Mansions. Players will take on the role of trying to work their way through the massive mansion while trying to achieve their objectives, and prove to be Lorna's true friend. Each player knows of the other players that are within the mansion and views them as someone who is trying to steal what is there. The player to achieve the goals, will be considered the winner and thus the true friend of Lorna. You will have at times, skills that you can earn or possibly steal. You can also acquire assets and or weapons that will aid you in your task at hand.

Classified Prototypes are very hard to get but are extremely useful if acquired. One example of a Classified Prototype is being able to gain control over the Knights for one turn, be able to capture as well as then send adversaries to the Storage Room and be locked in.

The mansion has its own elements that are going to be hard to get around but with how it has been designed there are also a few very useful elements it also offers. One such benefit is the Security access key, that if acquired gives you additional passages to expedite your journey. Using these and planning your moves well are very important to locate and acquire the "Inheritances". Once achieved then your next task is going to be getting all required items to get out without losing what you have and is needed to take back to Lorna.

Each time a player has a turn, they will draw and event card prior to their role. This will effect their planning and next move or in some cases change everything with the fact the Mansion, Vonya and the Knights are a ever present factor. There are (158) Event Cards Alone.

Additionally in a players turn they can choose to have PVP prior to drawing or roll of dice, depending on cards you may hold and where the other player may be.

Your movement, planning and deck building, will be key to your acquiring what you need and escaping the mansion! (327) Total Cards In Cypress Legacy: The Board Game

Whether you are two players or six, from the first roll to success, the drama to acquire what you need and escape grows continually. This feature is in the game every time you play and with the design, also gives great replayability.

It has taken some time and a lot of changes especially over the last year and a half, but we do now finally have our first run in and are also taking in dealers now. The game has undergone a lot of revisions and art changes. We wanted to take the extra time to adjust the game play and have a very good balance to the game. Now we are very happy with the results and are beginning to get the game out. (Please note this is not a "Legacy" game, this is part of the title because of the overall story.)

Cypress Legacy: The Board Game is based on the Cypress Inheritance Saga.
 OBJECTIVE: Use Weapons, Skills, Assets, and Classified Prototypes to be the first player to escape the Cypress Mansion with all the required inheritance items and be Lorna’s proven friend.

STORY: The story you are playing within begins with Lorna Ritten just learning of Alfred Cypress, the grandfather she has never known. Lorna has always wanted to find out more about her biological family, which has always been a mystery. Her grandfather’s attorney, Phillip Brandt, tells Lorna of an inheritance, which includes one of her grandfather’s many mansions and its contents. Her desire to know more marks the beginning of a very unique and potentially dangerous situation. Lorna has no idea just how important this actually is to her and will be to others. As Lorna is studying some of the inheritance documents before visiting the mansion, she realizes there are objects that hold key information hidden throughout the mansion.

Also note the complete Cypress Legacy: The Board Game Manual in the files below. (Note the player versus player elements in the manual)

The Novel Series has gone through a lot of changes as well and the first novel will be available soon.

—description from the publisher

Name: Renown
Description:
In a world filled with catastrophes, magical mishaps, and big personalities, you have always been lost in the shuffle. Now, yet another disaster has befallen your home, Gloria’s Landing, destroying much of the town in the process. Your chance has finally arrived. It is time to step it up and be more than a follower. It is finally time to gain the renown you’ve always deserved.

Taking on quests, defeating monsters, and fighting your fellow townsfolk, this task won’t be for the feint of heart. Do your best to stay righteous, or give into a life of dishonor. The choice is yours. What will you do to gain renown?

In the Renown card game, you take control of one of 12 unique personalities from the town of Gloria’s Landing. The goal of the game is simple: you want your personality to gain enough Renown to become the next big thing. You’ll gather followers, go on quests, and plot against your competition. The player who reaches twenty Renown first wins.

In this fantasy based card game each turn players will play followers, actions, and use abilities to gain Renown. Afterward they may go on quests where success or failure determines their fate. Play continues around the table, vying for position, until one player reaches their Renown goal.

Name: Pummeleinhorn: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
Together with the Pummeleinhorn and his friends, players of Pummeleinhorn: Das Kartenspiel want to plan the fluffiest parties of the year! The ingredients: party hats, cookies and glitter — lots of glitter!

Whoever arranges three different parties first wins, and to do this, players collect Pummeleinhorn cards until they can put together a suitable combination and fulfill the task of a party card. Will you attempt to plan a cookie-munching party for your friends, or will you dare attempt the legendary magical karaoke party?

Name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series I – Scenario 06: Bounty Hunt
Description:
Two cosmic adventurers are in a tricky scenario and must work together. By rolling and manipulating dice for special abilities and combos, you can be the one that guides them to victory.

The four planets of the Tetran System light up the display as your ship drops out of hyperspace.

"Remember, the mark came here for a reason. Every misstep we make is an opportunity for him to get ready for our arrival."

Now, should we split up, or stick together?"

The bounty has been tracked to the risky Tetran Sector. Use resources to capture the bounty to win. Lose if either character loses all health.

Bounty Hunt is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.

This scenario has only been released separately as Print & Play, but was then included in Twin Stars: Adventure Series I.

Name: Chronicle of Kings
Description:
Chronicle of Kings is set during the Viking age (700-1000) in the Fate of the Norns universe. Players take on a dynasty of Viking rulers who wish to be immortalized in legend.

Victory is achieved by being the bloodline with the most renown, and the game rewards players for memorable play. There are many ways to achieve renown, allowing players to pursue different paths to victory.

Every turn the players perform many actions, which include: quests, military conquests, trade/raid, diplomatic intrigue, etc. Each turn spans several years, meaning that the bloodline will need to plan for marriage and children. Mechanics are designed to tell a vivid and memorable story.

The world is not static, and every turn events occur necessitating that sometimes the player work together to overcome a shared challenge.

The game also features a campaign book, allowing for solitaire play.

Name: Binatang
Description:
Binatang is a big strategy game for the whole family. Unchartered territories, inexplicable wild animals and a secret path will be on the table for your family evenings and your time with friends.

What is this game about?

Each player needs to create a sanctuary and fill it with various wild animals separating the territory between different kinds. There is a choice to be made: do you get the rarest animals or do you get as many as possible of  a common kind? Choose your strategy! Each inhabitant in your sanctuary gets you closer to the win! The winner is the one who moves further than others along the secret path.

What’s unique about this game?

The player fills the game space with various animals according to his own plan. And at the same time each move of any other player can change this tactic. Do you need a strategy or you just rely on luck? To focus on creating your own sanctuary or to try influencing the plans of others? Stick to your own style and remember, that even the youngest players have a good chance to outmaster seasoned strategists!

Who is this game for?

Family time with kids
    Kids parties
    Teenagers

—description from the publisher

Name: Special Ops Issue #7
Description:
Special Ops #7 has eight articles, two ASL scenarios, two ASLSK scenarios, and Autumn For Barbarossa, a complete Standard Combat Series (SCS) game.

Articles for this issue:
FIGHTING THE MYTH - A Preview of “Baptism By Fire” (BCS). By Carl Fung.
ANGOLA! - A Shorter Scenario and Some Play Balance Options. By Bruce Monnin.
OPERATIONAL COMBAT SERIES - From Good to Great. By Dmitry Klyuykov.
BCS SHOCKERS - BCS Concepts That Might Shock A Traditional Player. By Dean Essig.
THE FINE POINTS OF PILLBOXES - By Zeb Doyle.
FROM EUROPE TO THE PACIFIC - A Preview of ASLSK PTO. By Ken Dunn.
SOVIET PLAY IN CASE BLUE (OCS) - And A Little German Strategy, Too. By Chip Saltsman.
WHICH SCENARIO SHOULD I PLAY? - Rating OCS Scenarios. By John Bowen.

ASL/ASLSK scenarios:

    ASL SCENARIO O13 - Road to Rome. By Ian Daglish.
    ASL SCENARIO O14 - Wiking Horde. By Brian Youse.
    ASLSK SCENARIO S60 - Operation Niwi. By Joe Gochinski.
    ASLSK SCENARIO S61 - Help Our Troops Out. By Brendan Deller & Sean Deller.
Families: Game: Advanced Squad Leader Starter Kit

Name: Steel Arena: Arsenal
Description:
Fighting in the arena continues. Day by day, oil flows like water, metal groaning as the sound of gunshots spreads across dozens of kilometers along the empty streets of the city.

The Steel Arena: Arsenal expansion changes the basic rules of the game, offering players four new game modes and providing new attack modules and terrain tiles. Now you can speed up your robots, start the game with extra munition, play with new special abilities that are different for each robot, or add some explosive power to your game using new mine tiles!

You can use all four game variants together or combine them in any way you like.

Name: Air Raid
Description:
The idea of the game is to fly the planes across no-man's land, into enemy territory and bomb enemy buildings or ammunition dumps and at the same time protect property within own territory from being destroyed by enemy air raids.  The planes start from the first row, move into a formation giving the best advantage, cross no-man's land where they Weill be met by opponents' planes in an attempt to resist the attack.  Planes will be shot down and taken from the board, bombs dropped and buildings destroyed.  In the end the game will be won by the General of the air.
—description from the rulebook

The game includes fighters which can move straight up to 3 spaces or move less and turn.  Bombers can move straight 2 spaces or less and turn.

Supports up to 4 players with 4 sets of planes.

Name: Scheibenkleister!
Description: Each of the up to 4 players has to move (options as in Halma) 6 of the 10 pawns to the opposite side of the board. Once a player successfully reaches the goal zone with one pawn the center disc of the game board is rotated 90° left or right. The first player to bring 6 pawns to the goal zone wins.

Name: Dirty Diction
Description:
Dirty Diction is the new Adult Party Game! Have fun! Laugh at your friends! Dirty Diction is the new, hilarious, and slightly educational, party game of idioms, phrases and slang! There are eight different play challenges to get your team to be the first to five points! Act it out! Draw it! Vote on which player is most likely associated with it! Set players up like human mannequins! Do whatever it takes to beat the competition! Watch out though! ‘All In’ challenges could put you ahead or take away your lead! Liven up your game night with Dirty Diction!

—description from the publisher

Name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift – Gamer's Bundle Edition
Description:
Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift is intended to be a new kind of dungeon crawl, one that embraces the European school of game design with clever and elegant mechanisms and emphasizes strategy while minimizing luck. Cooperation, planning, and the enemy response deck eliminate the need for chucking dice, creating a tense combat environment with meaningful decisions! The rondels provide another tactical layer, including the enemy's devious and challenging AI.

The rules allow you to learn to play in 15 minutes, with a typical game round lasting less than ten minutes, even with up to six players, but deep, strategic cooperation will be required for your band of heroes to make it through to the Abyssal Rift and maybe even come out alive.

Perdition’s Mouth is designed to be played as a story-supported campaign over several gaming sessions. In the campaign, you have to fight through at least six increasingly challenging scenarios and the level of success during each adventure has a direct effect on the rest of the story. Can you survive the labyrinth of the insectoid god?

Perdition’s Mouth: Abyssal Rift Gamer’s Bundle edition contains all and everything the Retail edition does along with two mini-expansions, Hideout and Witch’s Grotto.

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Grunts
Description: Composed of 1 Martian commander, 1 Martian fighter with freezing ray, 8 Martian fighters with disintegrating rifles

Name: Pelegrinus
Description:
6th century ... Saint-Benoît has just finished writing his rule. He describes in 73 chapters how the life of the monks should be managed. Here comes the time of the monastic orders. They will organize themselves and seek to develop their influence.

In Pelegrinus, you lead one of them, launch yourself into the spiritual conquest of Europe. Consolidate your influence by building commandies across the continent, then erect powerful abbeys to assert your power in different regions. Do not forget the intrigues of the papal courts, for the support of the sovereign pontiff will often be valuable to you. Lastly, gather under your protection various relics and maintain a firm control over the lucrative pilgrimage routes. However, you are not alone; other orders intrigue in the shadows to double you on the path of power.

—description from the publisher

Name: Neighbor of the Beast
Description:
Each player is in charge of a different color group of houses in the neighborhood.This game uses territory control and "Take-that!" game mechanics. Every time The Beast is moved to a different house or is annoyed by his neighbors, he gets angrier and angrier. The cards present methods of moving The Beast or rearranging the layout of houses in the neighborhood, and have different anger values for each such method. When The Beast's total anger value reaches the breaking point, he RAGES and destroys all houses adjacent to his.

Each player must manage when and where The Beast rages, thus destroying the houses around him. The ultimate goal is to have more of your opponents' houses destroyed than yours. When The Beast lives in one of your houses, you actually gain points. When The Beast lives next to one of your houses, there's risk of him destroying them in a fit of rage, costing you points. All other houses out of harm's way (not adjacent to The Beast) tally point values as well. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – US Soldiers
Description:
This expansion is composed of:

1 Sargent, 1 USA soldier with missile launch, 2 USA soldiers with machine guns, 6 USA soldiers

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Science Division
Description:
This expansion is composed of:

Chief Surgeon Gorl & Wrex 
Science Division Unit Commander 
Science Division Engineer 
Science Division Trooper with Heavy Blaster 
6 Science Division Troopers

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Stealth Martians
Description:
This expansion is composed of:

1 Martian Infiltrator Commander, 1 Martian Infiltrator with Sniper Rifle, 3 Martian Combatants with Blaster Rifles

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Marines
Description:
This expansion is composed of:

1 Martian Marine Commander, 1 Martian Marine with missile launcher, 3 Martian Marines with disintegrating rifles

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Novas Vira Militia
Description:
This expansion is composed of:

1 Agent Jack Falco, 1 Agent Natalya El, 1 Sonic alteration device with operator, 1 Weapons team of Novas Vira, 4 Novas Vira militiamen

Name: Vikings Gone Wild: 1st Season Pack
Description:
This pack adds cards for the base game Vikings gone Wild. This 1st Season Pack contains the 108 Kickstarter Exclusive cards from Kickstarter:
20 Divine Favor cards
25 Odin's Path Cards
11 Event Cards
9 Mission Cards
22 Unit Cards
4 Defense Cards
12 Building Cards
5 End Game Bonus Cards
Total = 108
(NOTE: There is also 1 Event Setup Card.)

Name: Thunder Alley: Crew Chief Expansion – The Dice Tower Effect Promo Pack
Description:
Pack of 8 cards to expand Thunder Alley: Crew Chief Expansion from the 2017 Dice Tower Indiegogo campaign

Limitations: 

    One card per player.
    Use once then remove from game.
    Roll before movement is started.


Solo Movement

     Change MP to WTP.
     Add Pit Speed to MP
     Reduce wear from card.
     Add 1d6 to MP
     Add Clean Air at end of move
     Free lane changes


Lead Movement

     Free lane changes
     Add Pit Speed to MP
     Reduce wear from card. Perm to Temp. Temp to none.
     Add 1d6 to MP
     All moves may be diagonal
     Break link anywhere behind you


Draft & Pursuit Movement

     Split Movement between two cards.
     Add Pit Speed to MP
     Ignore wear from card.
     Add 1d6 to MP
     Ignore text on card if desired
     After move, Use Pit Speed for solo WTP.


WTP: Work the Pack or Overtake in Grand Prix.
Reduce Wear: Permanent to Temporary. Choose any Temporary token.
Diagonal: All diagonal movement must be into an empty space.
Split Movement: Active car moves first and takes the wear. Must use at least half MP.
Draft: Line Movement in Grand Prix.

Name: Midnight Brunch
Description:
Will you be able to pick up the best group of these monstrous diners to spell with them the nicest portions of Midnight Brunch?

Players every turn should try to get the best score by adding the different values â€‹â€‹of their Monster cards, possibly by helping with the effects of some special cards.

Using an betting mechanic, everyone will have to point to the food they want to eat. But you have to evaluate your score well and try to guess the opponent's hand: as they bluffing or are they really strong?

Will it be better to focus on substandard foods and risk being left dry or having little or no rest?
Who will be more skillful and lucky at the end of 6 rounds of banqueting, will be the winner and "ladies of the night" !!

Name: Opale Noir
Description:
Opale Noir is a game where you play as precious stones hunters. 
Your goal is to acquire a collection of stones among the rarest and most prized of the planet: Alexandrites, Benitoites, Jadeites, Painites.
In this game all the moves are allowed; you will have recourse to the crime, to the magic of the stones (in other words Lithomancy), to the political manipulations of the Metropoles, to negotiation and other subterfuges to reach your goal.

Players with the most Prestige points win the game.

The mining empires can quickly ascend and be of a formidable power, but here all power is more or less an illusion and many empires have only a fear, see their inconsistency unraveled, end up disfigured by some birds of prey until the fragments of their formerly imposing forces eventually turn against them. Bluff, audacity and deterrence are essential compensating factors for the success of such empires.
It would be sage to mention that these empires share their intrinsic apprehension with the clarity, ruthlessly attract players fanatic of the order, suspecting and nosing without intransigence or even players without morals that such parasites survive to them.
Let us mention again the Lithomanian players who under the blindness of their autarkic devellopement bring to their entourage the severe weight of their misdeeds and spells.
zEach puzzle of these great strategic currents offers their pieces, free to each of them to arrange on the woof of an original and inventive strategy.
We are dealing here with a fierce competition for limited resources, whose pecuniary values and interest in terms of objective correspond to a tight and fluctuating timing.
Within this latent tension it is up to the players to contain their disconveniences because expansion and margins of actions are amply dependent on a collaboration of good quality, sometimes forced, if not imposed.
A world where raptors and wolves live under the cover of a lamb will be very sad if the spirits of the stones are displeased by so many lithurgical vacarmes and human activities, mingle with the party, leaving their apparitions to their disappearance that a trail of desolations, whose effects will be crescendo with the power of the players, frequencies of irruption will go along with the frenetic appetite of the players for the inestimable stones.
- The Prestige, A balancing act
This game will still be far too wise if there was this subtle tension of the tightrope walker on his rope, handle this wrist of markers "Useful to do everything" and which at the slightest false step sticks crumpled after crumb at the bottom of a chasm, offers salt and pepper to the most deceitful.
Players will judicieusemet, meticulously, split their markers to see the immobilized on options broken down between the game board, the recruiting board and their personal trays.
- The Prestige, deep strategy
Like a game of chess the order is reversed here, the beginning of the game wide open, the abundance and the adaptability of the choices (however tempered by some pecuniary need
and the always too measured coming of the stones) nourish the naiveté of the player, alas for the most part the net does not close too quickly, the voices of survival is reduced and the actions which there will be no need for an interest in an andean are gradually taking on a disproportionate importance.
The players will end up breathless, until the last final moment, but is it not out of breath that it builds the prestige of a victory?

—description from the designer

Name: Alexander's Campaign: Mini Expansion
Description:
The mini expansion includes 3 new Alexander's generals in the game:

- Seleucus (player mat, special ability tile and conquest point token)

- Perdiccas (player mat, special ability tile and conquest point token)

- Lysimcachus (player mat, special ability tile and conquest point token)

Name: NewSpeak: Dissonance
Description:
1-2 player expansion for NewSpeak.

For the 1-player component of NewSpeak: Dissoance, players take the role of a solitary Moderator, looking over a conversation between two suspected dissidents, which you must decode using the Moderator Code Cards and Moderator Dashboard as you would in the core game.

Incorrectly determining the meeting location of dissidents will lead to penalties as well as additional clues as you progress through a narrative campaign.

For the 2-player component of NewSpeak: Dissonance, players adopt the personas of two dissidents, attempting to communicate with each other to meet in secret without falling foul of the watchful gaze of the ModNet. Players each have access to incomplete information, which they must use in tandem by communicating using a limited set of coded messages to coordinate their movements.

Name: Small World: Sky Islands
Description:
Small World: Sky Islands introduces seven new races and powers to the Small World base game, but it also gives those races — and all the previously released races — new territory in which to fight for control.

At the start of play, place the Sky Islands game board so that it shows either two or three islands in the sky (your choice), then use the Small World game board as if you were playing with one fewer player, i.e., use the four-player board when playing with five players. Next, place access points to the Sky Islands — the beanstalk and the stairway — on different regions on the game board. Whenever a race stands on one of these access points, they can try to conquer the space on the sky islands that shows the matching symbol.

Races can't start their conquests in the Sky Islands unless their power specifically allows them to do so. At the end of a turn, if you control all of the regions on a Sky Island, you gain one additional coin.

Name: Meade's Turn: The Mine Run Campaign and Gettysburg
Description:
Two division level American Civil War games. Uses the same system as the designer's previous At All Hazards game with two changes plus additional game specific rules.

Corps, Cavalry, and Supply wagons are activated by chit-pull. Each unit on the map is a Division with off map tracking boxes for supply, fatigue, and stragglers for each Division.  Divisions have between one and four steps. Turns represent 3 1/2 hours and map hexes are approx. 1/2 mile across.

Gettysburg is won on geographical objectives with step losses counting, too. Mine Run is won solely on the basis of damage to the enemy force.

Only a playtest version produced.  The designer also produced an experimental order system inspired by the Gamers' CWB (but without writing).
